Package de.oth.blocklib.networking

Class NetworkMessage

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.networking.NetworkMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnimationMessage, BlockChangedMessage, ChatMessage, ChunkMessage, ChunkRequestMessage, ClientIdMessage, CommandMessage, EntityDespawnMessage, EntityInfoMessage, EnvironmentTimeSyncMessage, EnvironmentWeatherMessage, FluidSpawnedMessage, HealthUpdateMessage, JoinedMessage, KillClientMessage, NpcSpawnedMessage, NpcUpdateMessage, PingMessage, PlayerSpawnedMessage, SaveMessage, WorldItemSpawnedMessage
public abstract class NetworkMessage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Encapsulates a network message.
Custom messages transporting information between the client and the server should implement this interface.
Since:
2020
Author:
Matthias Wagner, Philipp Dormeier (HSP-SoSe 2020 Network)
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • requiresRetransmission

      public abstract boolean requiresRetransmission()
      Override this method to define whether the NetworkMessage requires reliability.
      there can be two types of messages:
      - messages that transport information that is needed frequently. That data should be sent each tick (e.g. players' positions). This helps to keep latency low.
      - messages that transport information which is needed infrequently. That data is sent manually when needed and therefore needs to be retransmitted when the packet is lost.

      If retransmission is requested, this NetworkMessage is guaranteed to arrive at the remote host at least once.

      Returns:
      return true to request retransmission if the packet gets lost

    • replaces

      public abstract boolean replaces​(NetworkMessage networkMessage)
      Override this method to define whether this NetworkMessage represents a more recent version of another NetworkMessage.
      This allows the network stack to drop older messages that are no longer relevant.
      Parameters:
      networkMessage - a previously sent message
      Returns:
      true if this message can replace the other message

    • getMessageId

      public short getMessageId()
      Returns the ID for this message. The default implementation returns the ID for this message type as registered in MessageRegistry
      Returns:
      this message type's ID
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this type of message was not yet registred at MessageRegistry

    • requiresCompression

      public final boolean requiresCompression()
      Used to determine whether the serialized form of this message shall be compresed via Stream Compression. Default value: false
      Returns:
      true - if this message's serialized form shall be compressed for actual transmission
      See Also:
      requireCompression
